item.title: M.2 PN532 NFC Module
item.description:
Overview

The M.2 PN532 NFC Module is a compact and versatile NFC/RFID reader/writer module in the popular M.2 form factor. Built around the NXP PN532 chipset, it supports multiple contactless communication protocols and is perfect for payment systems, access control, and IoT applications.

Key Features

  • PN532 Chipset: Industry-standard NFC controller
  • Multiple Protocols: ISO14443A/B, FeliCa, MIFARE
  • M.2 Interface: Standard M.2 Key-E connector
  • Read/Write Support: Full NFC tag read and write capabilities
  • Flexible Integration: Works with various M.2 host boards
  • Open Source: Complete documentation and examples

Specifications

  • Chipset: NXP PN532
  • Interface: M.2 Key-E (2230)
  • Protocols: ISO/IEC 14443 Type A/B, FeliCa, MIFARE Classic/Ultralight
  • Operating Frequency: 13.56 MHz
  • Communication: I2C, SPI, UART
  • Operating Voltage: 3.3V
  • Operating Range: Up to 5 cm
  • Dimensions: M.2 2230 (22 x 30 mm)

What’s Included

  • 1x M.2 PN532 NFC Module
  • Quick Start Guide
  • Online documentation access

Use Cases

  • Contactless payment terminals
  • Access control systems
  • Smart card readers
  • NFC tag programming
  • Product authentication
  • Data exchange applications

Getting Started

  1. Insert the module into an M.2 Key-E slot on your host board
  2. Install the required drivers and libraries
  3. Configure the communication interface (I2C/SPI/UART)
  4. Test with NFC tags or cards
  5. Integrate into your application

Resources

  • Documentation
  • Code Examples
  • Datasheet

item.title: Walkie-Talkie Module
item.description:
Overview

Pitaya Go is a compact, feature-rich IoT development board powered by the Nordic nRF52840 SoC. It’s designed for battery-powered IoT applications with built-in battery management and charging capabilities.

Key Features

  • Powerful SoC: Nordic nRF52840 with Bluetooth 5
  • Battery Ready: Built-in LiPo battery charger and management
  • Rich Peripherals: Multiple sensors and interfaces
  • Low Power: Optimized for battery-powered applications
  • USB-C: Modern USB-C connector for programming and charging
  • Compact Size: Perfect for portable projects

Specifications

  • SoC: Nordic nRF52840
  • CPU: ARM Cortex-M4F @ 64 MHz
  • Flash: 1 MB
  • RAM: 256 KB
  • Wireless: Bluetooth 5.0, Thread, Zigbee
  • Battery: LiPo charger (up to 500mA)
  • USB: USB-C (USB 2.0)
  • Sensors: Temperature, accelerometer, ambient light
  • Dimensions: 35 x 45 mm

What’s Included

  • 1x Pitaya Go Board
  • 1x USB-C Cable
  • Documentation & Examples
  • Plastic enclosure (optional)

Perfect For

  • Wearable devices
  • Environmental monitoring
  • Smart home sensors
  • Asset tracking
  • Portable IoT projects

Getting Started

  1. Connect Pitaya Go to your computer via USB-C
  2. Install the development environment
  3. Try the pre-loaded examples
  4. Add a LiPo battery for portable operation
  5. Build your IoT application

For detailed guides and examples, visit our documentation portal.
